member.name: T:OpenCloudServer.Controllers.FilesController
member.summary: Http controller for all request with url /files

member.name: M:OpenCloudServer.Controllers.FilesController.PostFile(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IFormFile)
member.remarks: Uploading a file to the server. The server allows to upload any file format and any size. The file size limitation can be configured in the appsettings.json server configuration file.

member.name: M:OpenCloudServer.Controllers.FilesController.GetFilesByOwner(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.remarks: Returns a list of files the user has access to.
member.param: The file number from which the file list will start. Required for the result of paging and used in conjunction with the "limit" parameter.
The maximum number of files that can be returned.
The field for filtering by the part of name example: name=drawing
The field for filtering by the file type for separate use | example ext=rvt|dwg
The field for filtering by the file id for separate use | example id=6108f583052673585c8e2b83|6108f583052673585c8e2b10
asc or desc for oerder by use created time
member.response: Successful request for getting user`s files
Unsuccessful request for getting user`s files

member.name: M:OpenCloudServer.Controllers.FilesController.DeleteFileById(System.String)
member.remarks: Removes the original file from the server and all attached files.

member.name: M:OpenCloudServer.Controllers.FilesController.UploadForDownloads(System.String,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IFormFileCollection)
member.remarks: The method allows to upload additional files and attach them to an existing file on the server. This method is used only by the JobRunner to upload the results of completed Jobs.

member.name: M:OpenCloudServer.Controllers.FilesController.DownloadOriginal(System.String)
member.remarks: Allow to download the source file.

member.name: M:OpenCloudServer.Controllers.FilesController.Downloads(System.String,System.String)
member.remarks: Allow download files associated with the original file or files created by JobRunner. To download the original file, need to specify the file id and its format in the url. For example, GET /files/5f033f8a2760a800080bf268/download/5f033f8a2760a800080bf268.rvt

member.name: M:OpenCloudServer.Controllers.FilesController.AddGeometry(System.String,OpenCloudServer.Models.Entities.GeometryMetadata)
member.remarks: The method allows to create meta information for the specified file. It is used by the JobRunner when generating geometry.

member.name: M:OpenCloudServer.Controllers.FilesController.GetGeometry(System.String)
member.remarks: Returns meta information on geometry that was generated from the file. Meta information is a list with descriptions of views. For example, for dwg it will be a "Model" space and layouts, and for rvt files it will be 3d views. Each view consists of a "database" and additional geometry data. To open geometry data in VisualizeJS follow these steps 1. download and open the database by next link "/files/{fileId}/geometry/{database}". 2. download and open all geometry chunks "/files/{fileId}/geometry/{geometry[0..n]}". Fragments of geometry can be opened in any order.

member.name: M:OpenCloudServer.Controllers.FilesController.GetProperties(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get object properties for specific file
member.remarks: Returns list with all native properties for the specified file in JSON format.
member.param: This parameter allows to filter the result for a specific object. It is necessary to pass the native object handle.

member.name: M:OpenCloudServer.Controllers.FilesController.Update(System.String,OpenCloudServer.Models.Entities.FileDataPut)
member.summary: Update information about file (name and preview)
member.remarks: Refreshes information about a file. In the request body can be specified only those parameters that need to be changed, all other parameters will remain unchanged.
member.param: JSON with key name and preview

member.name: M:OpenCloudServer.Controllers.FilesController.GetById(System.String)
member.remarks: Returns full information about uploaded file.
member.response: Successful request for getting file by id
Unsuccessful request for getting file by id

members.member:
Get CDA tree in JSON format
Returns CDA tree in JSON format.
File id/// Successful request for getting properties Invalid token Access denied Unsuccessful request for getting cda tree

member.name: T:OpenCloudServer.Controllers.JobsController
member.summary: Http controller for all request with url /jobs

member.name: M:OpenCloudServer.Controllers.JobsController.AddJob(OpenCloudServer.Models.Entities.JobPost)
member.remarks: Create a new job to retrieve geometry or property data. The status of the Jobs depends on the total number of Jobs in the system and the number of JobRunners. In the parameters need to pass the identifier of the file to be processed and the output format. The "geometry" format is used to extract only geometry data for visualization in the browser. The "properties" format is used to create native properties for objects. The "dwg" and "dxf" file formats can only be obtained from "vsf" files.
member.response: Can't find the file with the specified ID

member.name: M:OpenCloudServer.Controllers.JobsController.DeleteById(System.String)
member.remarks: Allows to remove a Job from the Job list. Can be used to clear the Job queue. The method does not delete or stop Jobs that are already being executed by the JobRunner.
member.response: Successful request for delete job by id
Can delete only a job with state waiting

member.name: M:OpenCloudServer.Controllers.JobsController.UpdateStatus(System.String,OpenCloudServer.Models.Entities.Job)
member.summary: Update some parameters for specific job (available only for admins)
member.remarks: Updates Job parameters. This method is used by the JobRunner to update the status of Jobs.
member.response: Successful request for updating status for specified job
This Job is busy by another user.
This Job has been closed and its parameters in this state cannot be changed.

member.name: M:OpenCloudServer.Controllers.JobsController.GetById(System.String)
member.remarks: Returns detailed information about the Job and its status.
member.response: Successful request for getting status for specified job
This Job has been closed and its parameters in this state cannot be changed.
Unsuccessful request for getting status for specified job

member.name: M:OpenCloudServer.Controllers.JobsController.GetAll(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get all jobs created by current user
member.remarks: Returns a list of jobs that were created by the current user. Allows to track the readiness of geometry data or properties data for the specified file.
member.param: The job number from which the job list will start.
Limit the number of files in a response
The field for filtering by the specified list of job states, use the symbol as a separator '|' example: state=running|waiting|done|failed|all
The field for filtering by the specified list of job indicators, use the symbol as a separator '|' example: id=60a224fe7b5a951ef8be6b4d|60a225207b5a951ef8be6b5d
The field for filtering by the specified list of file indicators, use the symbol as a separator '|' example: fileId=60a224fe7b5a951ef8be6b4d|60a225207b5a951ef8be6b5d
asc or desc for oerder by use created time
member.response: Successful request for getting status for specified job
This Job has been closed and its parameters in this state cannot be changed.
Unsuccessful request for getting status for specified job

member.name: M:OpenCloudServer.Controllers.BCF2.ProjectController.GetExtensionsById(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve a specific projects extensions. Project extensions are used to define possible values that can be used in topics and comments, for example topic labels and priorities. They may change during the course of a project. The most recent extensions state which values are valid at a given moment for newly created topics and comments.

member.summary: Puts a new BIM Snippet binary file to a topic. member.name: P:OpenCloudServer.Models.Entities.Job.Parameters
member.summary:
background: - type: string - default: 255,255,255 - description: final background color
default_color: - type: string - default: 102,102,102 - description: objects color for STL or OBJ formats
object_naming: - type: boolean - default: true - description: option specifies how geometry entities that are created during the import process are named. If value is "true", entities are named according to the file object names (for example, OdBmCircle).
clear_empty_objects: - type: boolean - default: true - description: during the conversion process, empty objects can be cleared. An example of an empty object is an entity or sub-entity without child objects (sub-entity or geometry).
ignore_point_size: - type: boolean - default: true - description: parameter responsible for the definition of point sizes during the file conversion.
thin_lines: - type: boolean - default: false - description: some objects in original files have a lineweight that is dynamically recalculated according to the current zoom state. If the rule for how to recalculate the lineweight is not known, these lineweights can be replaced with simple thin lines. This is the default behavior of the import functionality. If you want to display the real lineweight of elements instead, use "false" as a value.
facet_res: - type: number - minimum: 0.01 - maximum: 10.0 - default: 0.5 - description: this option uses a triangulation algorithm and are able to subdivide geometry when you need more details or on the contrary - remove details from geometry and increase performance. Facet resolution varies from 0.01 to 10.0.

member.summary: File ID that need to process

object_naming: - type: boolean - default: true - description: option specifies how geometry entities that are created during the import process are named. If value is "true", entities are named according to the file object names (for example, OdBmCircle).
clear_empty_objects: - type: boolean - default: true - description: during the conversion process, empty objects can be cleared. An example of an empty object is an entity or sub-entity without child objects (sub-entity or geometry).
ignore_point_size: - type: boolean - default: true - description: parameter responsible for the definition of point sizes during the file conversion.
thin_lines: - type: boolean - default: false - description: some objects in original files have a lineweight that is dynamically recalculated according to the current zoom state. If the rule for how to recalculate the lineweight is not known, these lineweights can be replaced with simple thin lines. This is the default behavior of the import functionality. If you want to display the real lineweight of elements instead, use "false" as a value.
facet_res: - type: number - minimum: 0.01 - maximum: 10.0 - default: 0.5 - description: this option uses a triangulation algorithm and are able to subdivide geometry when you need more details or on the contrary - remove details from geometry and increase performance. Facet resolution varies from 0.01 to 10.0.
